Reviews.Title: “Very large apartment and excellent value by Sydney Standards”
Reviews.Author: MattJMurray
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a 2 bedroom apartment but there had been a double booking and fortunately we were given a 1 bedroom apartment each which worked out very well. The apartment is fully equipped with all kitchen equipment, a tv in the bedroom and living room, washer/dryer and a large balcony. Location is slightly out of the way, being a good 30-40 minute walk to Circular quay (the Opera House etc) but there is a train station very close by which gets you into the city very quickly. For the amount we paid, and by the generally outrageous prices of literally everything else in Sydney, this was by far and away the best value we found during the trip.

Reviews.Title: “OAKS HARMONY GIVES OAKS HOTEL GROUP A BAD NAME”
Reviews.Author: MaryC4505
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several OAKS apartment hotels around NSW and must say that my first experience at OAKS Harmony was very disappointing from the moment I arrived for my 5 night stay over the NYE period which I brought my grandchildren to as a special treat to watch the Sydney fireworks. After being asked to pre-pay at check-in the almost $2,500 for 5 nights, I was overcharged by $185 and then told to sign a $150 pre-authorisation for "incidentals". I was then told that because of the public holidays there would be no housekeeping until the following Tuesday (I checked in on Friday 30th December). When I arrived at our 19th floor 2 bedroom apartment I was quite relieved to find it clean and spacious but for 5 people there were only 4 towels so I went back down to reception to ask for more towels only to be told that it would cost me $2 for each extra towel. I said that women like to have a towel for their hair to which it was repeated to me that it would cost $2 each for extra towels to which I replied to put it onto the "incidentals". I remarked that I have stayed at several OAKS hotels and have never been charged for extra towels and in fact have never been charged for extra towels at other hotel groups around the globe. How disappointing after spending $2,500 for 5 nights to then be charged $2 for each extra towel. I was furious because it wasn't the money but the principle of the matter. But a more stressful situation was to come... We set out about town for that day and night (the good thing about the hotel is that it is in an ideal location close to everything) and the following afternoon after we had all been for a swim (using the same bath towels from the previous night's shower, the morning shower, and for after swimming and shower), I rang reception asking for our towels to be replaced and at first was told housekeeping was not open but after I persisted, stating they can't expect us to use the same towels for 5 days, I was told to bring the towels to reception to be replaced as there was nobody else on duty. I felt humiliated lugging all the wet towels into the lift in front of other guests down to reception to be replaced. This was definitely not a good look for a hotel lobby! For the next few days I decided to wash the towels myself in the apartment washing machine and dryer rather than being put through that stress again of practically begging for clean towels. It's those little things that spoil what should have been a very satisfying experience. However I decided to get on with my holiday because I was happy with the apartment with its big balcony and the hotel's great location. I was very pleased on checkout to find the charge for the extra towels had been waived, so whilst my arrival experience was quite unpleasant, my departure was much much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: TomDUSA
Reviews.Content: I was in Sydney for 17 days on business. The 1 br unit I had was fine, street noise minimal and the room very comfortable. Pretty full kitchen although cooking utensils are light. Plenty of TV channels but could use a newer TV. Washer and Dryer IN UNIT. VERY nice to have on a longer trip. Location is good - but it's in Haymarket which is a jumping part of Sydney with lots of food choices and lots of students etc. Wasn't ever an issue for me. Very close to Central Station which makes getting around super easy. Lots of room in the unit - and given a tiny room in a place like the Travellodge (horrid) cost more or the same I'm happy to do without a restaurant or room service. Cons - not many really. Carpet could be cleaner and reception is only open 8am-8pm - not an issue for me but could be for others. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spacious accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy J
Reviews.Content: My family was coming over to Sydney for a visit, so I chose to put them in Oaks Harmony for a week. I was very happy with my decision. The apartment was spacious, clean, and affordable. The location is right by Central Station and George St. so it's extremely convenient and surprisingly not noisy at all. If you're looking for a decent serviced apartment in Sydney, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “great location great price”
Reviews.Author: findmeontheplaya
Reviews.Content: staying here was cheaper for 1 week then 3 nights at hotels in the cbd. the oaks harmony is close to the train station and nearby paddys market and monorail stations. the pool was really nice, the gym was good enough to get a quick workout in, but nothing special and most of the cardio equipment was broken. the 2 bedroom apartments are really nice, lots of room and a good view of the city, but the walls are pretty thin so you can hear your neighbors. the staff was helpful and the thai restaurant at the street level is absolutly amazing. you definitly get more than you pay for and i would reccomend this to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be steamed cleaned.”
Reviews.Author: DFQLD
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the staff were ok, not great, just ok and the whole apartment needs to be steamed cleaned!! When we went to use the saucepans they were still dirty from the last user! one still had water in it!! There was no frying pan. When we called to find out to get something done about it we were informed that we had to wait until housekeeping for the next day. We paid for self contained apartment!! This was not helpful as we bought goods to feed our kids. There is carpet on the different levels and throughout the aparments (only tiles in reception area, bathroom and toilets) and it needs to be steamed cleaned - the stench makes the apartments and the levels stink!!! We were there during the cooler months so we were able to open the door for some fresh air. Must be really bad during the hotter months. The bathroom needs to be steam cleaned too - there is mould and gunk buildng up that was a put off!! There are people that reside there - they were collecting there Addressed mail from reception!! The location is good as there are cafes, etc in the area, it is walking distance to Paddy's Market, Darling Harbour and Central Station is literally 5mins walk away and regular buses around the corner. We were there for a week's holiday and upon leaving we started to miss Sydney but we didn't really miss staying at the Oaks Harmony. (if there is a next time) when we go to Sydney we won't be staying at the Oaks Harmony.

Reviews.Title: “Two rooms : One tiny, one huge.”
Reviews.Author: DMelb
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms on this occasion - both were exactly the same price, both on the same floor, but they were vastly different in size. The cavernous one (on the Quay Street side of the building) was huge - a double balcony, massive living area and spacious bedroom. The smaller one was on the sidestreet, with a small corner balcony, tiny kitchen and a compact bedroom. Both were clean, relatively modern - and the service at the front desk was friendly and efficient. One big tip, however... You'll have to look real hard for the Oaks, because its entrance is tucked away behind a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JandDAuckland
Reviews.Content: We shared a 2 bedroom unit with another couple. One ensuite bedroom was downstairs at entry level, the other was upstairs along with another bathroom/laundry, kitchen and living area. Central Station and George Street with the buses were only 5 mins walk away. Paddy's Market and Darling Harbour approx 10 mins walk. Excellent location - once we found the hotel entrance..!! More signage at eye level needs to be in place for 1st timers - eg a sandwich board on the pavement. Even family from Sydney couldn't find it. There was a sign up high on a neighbouring building but we only noticed this later. The accommodation was excellent, very clean and room service daily. we had a room on an upper level. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst possible service staff”
Reviews.Author: Ruc3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days on a client visit. Apartment/location is all good, but reception staff especially amenities manager is terribly rude to everyone as if he owns the place. There is no other supervisor to escalate the complaint either. There were more 'DO NOT DO's than 'DO's in the building. Building management should look at consider teaching their staff some customer service if they want customers to come back to this hotel. Don't recommend this hotel at all, not going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings...”
Reviews.Author: jum253
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my partner and friends. Finding the hotel was very hard, no signs. Parking was extremely problematic. Underground car park had allocated spaces for hotel guests which is ridiculous as my partner had to drive around finding reserved spots. Access to lifts was extremely difficult as well. The staff at check-in was incredibly slow and not at all helpful or formal. On a budget, we booked a 2 bedroom apartment, which ended up been a split level room with the bedroom suite downstairs, and the main lounge area, kitchen and second bedroom upstairs. We didn't have any issues with the room arrangements. My partner & I gladly took the room downstairs since it gave us privacy. Balcony from the lounge area looked over to another building, not very scenic at all. For a 4 star hotel they should have a restaurant! We had dinner and buffet breakfast next door at Marque Hotel which is highly recommended, they had amazing food! We would have booked to stay there instead, but they had a min of 2 night stay. Overall, the rooms were clean and spacious, so no complaints there. Kitchen was also spacious. An average experience. I wouldn't recommend this hotel, and would not come back.

Reviews.Title: “There was nothing Harmonious about these Apartments”
Reviews.Author: MissT78
Reviews.Content: When we arrived about 9pm at night for check in, they only had a security guy on the desk to give out keys which was fine - except the additional arrangements we booked had not been supplied. He was unable to help us so we had to wait for the after hours care taker to speak too. She was incredibly rude and basically called us liars. There was not enough linen so we had to repeatedly ask for extra towels, sheets and pillows. The apartments itself was ok except for the huge dents all over the fridge door, the dirty toilet and the overall cleanliness of the apartment left a lot to be desired. I really would not recomment this place to anyone. Location was ok, the pool was nice except the floors leading down to it were covered in black dirt. Overall, this place leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy apartment but in a poor location”
Reviews.Author: Kebuh
Reviews.Content: Had occasion for a one night stay in Sydney on Australia Day. Problem started at the airport where the taxi driver had no idea where the hotel was located. We finally found it thanks to google maps on our handphone. Even then it was difficult coz the entrance is not clearly marked. The hotel is located at Haymarket which is at the southern side of China Town in Sydney and is mainly a student haunt given the Universities in the area. The Hotel is very close to Central Station and the bus depot but is still not in a desirable location. Room cleanliness was an issue with fruit flies in the room and the floor feeling grimy. The apartment allocated to us on the 8th floor was over 2 levels with one bedroom at the ground level and another bedroom and lounge/kitchen on the first floor. There's a small balcony off the lounge but it looks directly onto another building undergoing some renovations. Whilst the outside of the building was noisy at night, with the balcony door closed, you couldn't really hear the noise. The showers and air-conditioning in the hotel worked well but it was poor consolation for the location and general cleanliness of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations to the Oaks Harmony team”
Reviews.Author: PicklesNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Over the last 12 months I have stayed each month at the Oaks Harmony Apartments. I have never had a bad experience at the Apartment complex. Service is excellent and staff are always extremely helpful and welcome you warmly...always happy to assist at all times and make you feel at home. Apartments are always well presented with the most comfortable beds which ensures a great nights sleep and as well offer excellent value for money in the CBD of Sydney. Top location being a short walk to Central railway station, shuttle to airport, excellent secure parking underneathe at a very reasonabale rate and most importantly just a short walking distance to all major attractions. Top Thai restaurant at the front door and a short walk up George st for great Japanese food at Naruto Kitchen.Oaks Harmony is an apartment complex and not a hotel however having stayed in many locations including hotels and other apartment complexes in Sydney CBD over the last 10 years I would not want to stay anywhere else than Oaks Harmony. Maybe I should not being doing this review as more people will find out about Oaks Harmony however happy to share my great experience with fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach nest!”
Reviews.Author: JudgeCath
Reviews.Content: It was very disappointing as everyday, we see cockroaches come and go. Baby cockroaches also can be seen, even in the kitchen cabinets where plates are being placed. The shower is faulty and everything loose, they have allowed for this to continue and renting the apartment out. No views but location is excellent. Close to shops and restaurants. Staff have excellent service and patience but facility too poor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Handy Location.”
Reviews.Author: the_t_man05
Reviews.Content: This is a really handy hotel, easy to accesss trains and buses, just a walk from Central Station. Stayed the 1st week in a studio which was a bit small, old style CRT television with poor reception. Upgraded the 2nd week to a 1 bedroom apartment which was really nice. Great Thai food downstairs, staff seemed friendly, Great indoor pool however you have to walk past a stinky garbage room to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for visting main sites in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: wparfive1
Reviews.Content: Surrounding area can be a bit loud. However if you are looking for a hotel that is close enough to the Central bus station, Darling Harbor and Chinatown this place is it. We had an opportunity to stay in the 1 room suite and also a 2 room suite (2 levels). Definitely the 2 room will give you and your family ample room to stretch out and not feel like a bunch of sardines in a tin can. Ammenities were great, especially having a washer and dryer. Did try to go to the pool, but walking past the garbage bins down in the garage sort of takes the mood of swimming away. Service was great. There was one gentleman Tim Brennan who is one of the reception managers. If you find a way to check in with him, please try to do so. He was absolutely fantastic. Was really supportive of my family's needs and request. Overall my family really enjoyed our stay at the Oaks Harmony Apartment/Hotel, we would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “UNSAFE APARTMENTS”
Reviews.Author: Juandas
Reviews.Content: Dear Friends, Please be EXTRA careful with your luggage when you stay in this apartment. I lost 2 locked cabin sized luggages from our room. There was no sign of breaking-in, so the thief must either have a spare key or know well about this apartment. This apartment has only one CCTV camera. This is so unsafe. The police report was made and I hope the thief can be caught sooner or later.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I have ever recieved!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug67053
Reviews.Content: The service we received at this hotel was absolutely disgraceful. I would not recommend it to anyone. After being incredibly disappointed with our stay and notifying them when returning home the response was similarly very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MumTrav
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews before going to Oaks Harmony, i was prepared for the lack of signage and directions to this hotel. And boy, were the reviews right! For the information of anyone who will acutally use this review to stay - it is tucked behind a Thai resurant on the corner of Bijou Lane & Quay Street. DON'T use Google maps to find it, there directions will have you in the middle of Chinatown - 3 blocks away. Unit: 1 bedroom unit was ok, everything you would require for a 3+ days stay, although had to ring a few times to have basic things fixed and looked at. Bed: Warning - our bed was like sleeping on cement! Very hard and not comfortable at all. Location: Very awesome and central - but don't shop at the 24hr shops, take a walk to Coles on George St and save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, would never go back.”
Reviews.Author: bellebelle43
Reviews.Content: I had so many problems with this hotel from the start. 1. They lost our suitcase: we got there a few hours before check in so got them to hold our bags for us at reception, they put id tags on each and we were given tags to bring back to identify and collect our bags, we went back at check in time and one of the bags was missing, the receptionist tried to brush it off and send us to our room, but this bag was full of samples for a business trip that had about 6 months worth of work in them, it took about an hour for the bag to be tracked down, it had been given to another guest, I don't know how as you are supposed to have the matching tag with the id number on it to claim a bag. 2. Location of room was horrible: There were two of us travelling, both young females. The first room we were given was right next to the elevator on a very low level and the door did not lock properly so we did not feel safe here at all, we asked to be moved which they did but the room stunk and this door did not lock properly either but we dealt with it for one night before deciding to ask for a refund of the remaining 4 nights of our stay so that we could stay somewhere better. The receptionist also made this difficult and was unhelpful throughout our whole stay. 3. Location of the hotel was horrible: When booking I didn't realise it was in Chinatown, it was definitely not a pleasant location and not convenient either. I would never ever go back to this hotel, after staying one night here we went to Rydges in Sydney for the next 4 nights which was absolutely fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms need an update.”
Reviews.Author: emerging_lotus
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. Just up the road from Paddy's Market & across the road from Central train station. The rooms are looking very tired & need a bit of up dating. Staff are friendly & helpful. Accessing the pool is not easy & then when you find it you have to walk past the stinking garbage bins. Hotel is hard to locate so ring for directions to the parking garage before leaving home.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE FOR LONGER STAYS”
Reviews.Author: CredoLondon
Reviews.Content: I arrived with much trepidation having read negative reviews. However, receptionist had come in early to let me in after early am flight. & she and other staff all proved very helpful. Apartment was light and airy with well fitted kitchen and laundry etc. Large swimming pool . FANTASTIC location for food, transport (only 20 minutes door to door by train to airport) George street and Darling Harbour. Views nothing special but unbeatable place for convenience. However, apartments may be better suited to longer stay clients ( I was there a month and many people for longer) rather than 1-2 night stays. )

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Fluffy
Reviews.Content: Three colleagues and myself were booked into Oaks Harmony after we were unable to get double rooms at Oaks Goldsborough. We were attending a conference at the Convention Centre and had been told by the travel agent that it was only a 5 to 10 min walk. We found it to be more of a 10 to 15 min walk as the Convention Centre is very large and our sessions were located at the end far away from Chinatown. Two of us were booked into Room 138 on the 14th floor. The rooms were clean and tidy and it was great to have two bathrooms as it made getting ready in the morning so much quicker. The beds were king size and very comfortable. The lower bedroom had a TV on the wall and full bathroom with bath, shower and toilet. The upper bedroom had a bathroom with shower, toilet and a cupboard containing a washer and dryer. The kitchen had a microwave, fridge/freezer, oven, dishwasher and assorted small appliances. We didn't use the kitchen much but found the microwave a bit of hit and miss to operate. Instructions would have been helpful. We asked for a Welcome Booklet as we had no idea how to use the TV and couldn't figure out how to use the dishwasher either but eventually got it going by sheer fluke. There weren't any instructions on how to phone other apartments but the receptionist provided us with extension numbers. We used the pool but found it a bit unpleasant to access as we had to go past the rubbish skips. The pool however was good for a few early morning lengths and the spa was very welcome. There appeared to be a well equipped small gym but we never used it. The entrance to the apartments is set back from the street in a small outside foyer between a resturant and a coffee stand and a bit hard to find at first. The building is very secure requiring a swipe access to get in after hours and to access each floor from the elevator. Reception and after hours security were very pleasant and helpful. The apartments seem to have some more permanent occupiers as there was a bit of cooking smell wafting down the corridor. There were only a couple of negatives. One was the lingering smell of cigarette smoke in our apartment even though smoking is only permitted on the balcony, I would have preferred a smoke free apartment. The other negative was the sound of several skips being picked up and dropped off downstairs at 12.40am!!! It was loud enough to wake me up and was extremely annoying as it seemed to go on for a long time. However, saying that, my colleagues who had been booked into the Oaks Goldsborough complained that they had noise all night, every night from people walking to their rooms and banging doors. It's a wee distance from the central city but it didn't a huge effort to walk to Darling Harbour or get into the city using the Monorail. Overall our stay at Oaks Harmoney was pleasant and I would be happy to stay there again as a base for a holiday in Sydney. One word of warning, our trip from the airport cost $45 but our trip back to the airport cost $24. Check prices first.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Horrifiedkiwi
Reviews.Content: I really wish I had read the reviews before I booked my stay. As stated in the reviews I have only just read, finding the place was more than tricky, the poor Taxi driver thought he was going mad, come on how hard is a bit of sign writing? My view was of a car park building mmm very nice, curtains remained closed for the next 5 days there was no point in opening them! And they helped a little bit in decresing the stench of garlic wafting up from the Chinese takeaway right below my room. If you do not require sleep may I recommend you book room 43 on the 9th floor if the noisy neighbours don't keep you awake untill 3.15 am on a Wednesday night then the trucks that park in the ally below (for god knows what reason )will. And if that didn't keep you up all night the noisy heating will at least contribute to the deprivation you are longing for. ( It did help to un plug the rumbling fridge). Now the pool oh yuck, one trip past the rubbish area was enough to put me off. I don't understand why they advertise that as a "feature" I would be embarrased. My sink in the bathroom nearly overflowed every time I used it. I really have nothing good to say about this place other than it had a washing machine. I was so pleased to leave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, but beware of maintenance issues!”
Reviews.Author: QldFamilytraveller
Reviews.Content: I was going to share a two bedroom unit with my mother (we did book in advance) but only got the call a few days before that we had to be separated in one bedroom units - due to maintenance (their excuse). The units are clean and fairly modern, in a good area, close to Central station, Chinatown, darling harbour. We stayed during the hottest week in Sydney and the air conditioning in my room did not work!! They were not helpful at the front desk at all, and I even managed to track down the maintenance worker, who looked at the unit and said it can't be fixed. There were many other things in both our units that did not work - lights, both our TVs were not working properly etc. Being in a heat wave and having no air conditioning was extremely uncomfortable plus the fact the we had already been moved out of our original unit due to maintenance issues and not doing anything about it when asked, is unacceptable. It is a good hotel to stay at, but just beware if booking.

Reviews.Title: “A bit hard to locate”
Reviews.Author: rovingrabbit2
Reviews.Content: Four of us, all adults stayed in a two bedroom apartment in June 2009.We arrived by car and found the place a bit tricky to find in the street as the apartments are not well sign posted. The receptionist was helpful, but perhaps a little too busines like and not as welcoming as one might expect. Lighten up a bit please. It would be nice to be greeted with a smile. Parking is an extra $20 per night on top of the $522 we paid for two nights accommodation and is secure. We had a two bedroom apartment and it was on two levels with the first level containing a king size bed and a good sized ensuite.Up the stairs there is another bedroom with a king size bed with ensuite, a kitchen and a lounge area . The apartment was very clean and fresh smelling- no smoking permitted in the apartment which we thought was a great plus as we are all non smokers. The kitchen is pretty poorly equiped in my opinion- good electrical items, fridge , stove, microwave, dish washer, toaster, jug , but light on with the utensils- no fry pan and a limited amount of saucepans. No possibility of cooking bacon and eggs for breakfast. If I was staying longer I would have requested some more cooking utensils. The lounge/dining area had a table with 6 chairs but the lounge room only had enough seats for three people- a bit poor for a two bedroom place. The tv was a good size but the operating instructions were a bit light on. However, we got to the Foxtel channel after a bit of playing around. There are limited channels available on foxtel. The carpets were clean but starting to look a bit tired- perhaps they will squueze another 12 months out of them- no more I hope. The big plus with this place is the location, its right in Chinatown and a couple of minutes walk to the Paddy's market area and chinese restaurants. Our best find was the Thai restaurant (Satang Thai) downstairs- True tasting Thai food which hasn't been westernised (see separate review). I am fairly ambivilent whether I would stay here again-perhaps for four people, yes, because of the room to relax and talk, but for the two of us I suspect one of the hotels nearby and who charge similar rates would be the go.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: waikatogirl
Reviews.Content: Overall I have to say that our 2 night stay at Oaks Harmony was a little disappointing, the website looked really good, so was expecting great things. After travelling from Bangkok, and having no sleep for 48 hours, we arrived at Oaks Harmony at 7.30am. We dropped off our bags and asked if it was possible for our room to be one of the first to be ready once people checked out. They said that would be no problem (check in is normally 2pm). The person at reception said they would call us when our room was ready. After wandering around Sydney sleep deprived till 1pm we decided to make our way back to the hotel and wait in reception. The reception is not the nicest, so doesnâ€™t make the best first impression and we found that lots of taxis had trouble finding it, so make sure you have good directions. After waiting in reception for what seemed like forever we checked into our room at 3pm!!! I guess we were a little annoyed about this as they knew we were waiting, and other people were checking in before us. Our room was ok, but looking a little tired. But I think it was the little things that really bothered me about the room. There was still rubbish in our shower, the bathroom floor obviously hadnâ€™t been vacuumed properly with dust in the corners, and the pictures on the walls we hung so crookedly, it almost looked like it could be a joke â€“ how could a house keeper miss these things? The Oaks Harmony is in a good location, I would say moderately priced, but I donâ€™t think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic, modern accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Woody4295
Reviews.Content: The Oaks Harmony Apartments is comfortable and modern, with fairly basic rooms and facilities. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment, that was nice, but nothing special. The bathroom is spacious, with a large bath, and a good amount of bench space. The living area is small, and has lots of modern furniture that all seems to be white or made of glass. I was a little disappointed at some of it though - the coffee table was chipped and broken at one corner, and the desk was shoved in an awkward position between the two lounges. The bedroom was fine, a large cupboard, separate balcony and a comfortable bed. The room did not offer a fantastic view. If you looked straight down there was an alley with skip bins in it. Look ahead and you can see the rooftop pool of the Marque Hotel next door, which I must say is not a great sight. Look to the right and you get a bit of a mix. Down is an old, decrepit building whose windows are full of junk, but up is a nice view of the rooftops, and a stunning clock tower that is really quite beautiful. There were very effective blinds on the windows that were very successful in blocking out all light, so we had no issues about being woken up by the sunrise. We checked in after hours, so there was no one at the reception desk. Our check in must have pre-arranged, because a security guard was waiting to give us our keys. We didn't really encounter any service during our stay, so I cant comment on that aspect of the hotel. The pool, spa and sauna were adequate. The pool was small, and although the hotel website claimed it was heated, it didn't feel that way to me. To access the pool you had two options, neither of which is very appealing at all. You could take the lift down to the car park, walk past some construction material, down some concrete steps past the rubbish bins, and enter the pool area through a gate. You are surrounded by metal grilles and humming generator noises. It feels quite threatening and it not at all a pleasant way to get the pool. The second option is to walk out of reception, across a courtyard, that at night is cold and dark, down a long flight of stairs, and into the pool area. I felt a bit safer going this way, but it still is not ideal. Finding the hotel is a nightmare. There are no signs pointing to it, nobody seems to know where it is, and there isn't so much as the Oaks logo on the wall. I arrived by train at central station, and wandered around with my heavy luggage until I recognised the building from a photo I had seen. I would recommend that you bring a map so you can find it easily. All in all, the Oaks Harmony Apartments is alright. Nothing special, but not in any way bad. You will be comfortable there, but don't expect too much, because you probably won't get it.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Jerry-Kiwi
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is not great, it's not horrible, but just not great.. The entrance to this place is almost impossible to find, and the foyer and lifts are not much of a looker either.. The pool and gym area is not convenient. To our disappointment, in order to get there, we actually have to either go through the backdoor and through a dirty courtyard,OR through a carpark and a rubbish dump?!.. As much as we wanted to go for a dip, it was just too much trouble for a non-enticing pool.. The good news is the room was clean and well equiped. The kitchen was very good with a microwave, conventional oven, dishwasher and gas-stove. The bed was big and clean, as with the sofa and lounge area. Although we booked for studio room, our room had a bedroom which I really complaint about. This serviced apartment was not the best accomodation we've stayed in in Sydney. The fact that it is near the somewhat dirty Haymarket depreciates in value in my opinion. The room was great but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Apartment”
Reviews.Author: McafeeMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Great location and near restaurants. Apartments very very spacious as i travelled with 2 kids. Worth staying

Reviews.Title: “Ok for locals but not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: cmmoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Oaks Harmony for 6 nights in Jan/Feb 2009. It was "Ok Lah" but nothing special. At the end of the day...it's an apartment building that pretends to be a hotel. The room was fine but there was nothing to make you feel welcome or special. It was like staying in someone's apartment. It was great to have a laundry and kitchen (not that you need the kitchen with all the places to eat nearby). The location is extremely convenient. The reviews were right about the staff at reception. Sloppy. One girl looked like she'd just climbed out of bed. Oversized ugly uniform, messy hair, no make-up... NO smiles. When I arrived they were too busy [-] about another customer to serve me properly. The staff kitchen is directly behind the front desk and they were sitting there drinking coffee and whinging about their job. Not a great first impression. If you are a local and just in Sydney for a few days, this is a great place. You can do your own thing and it will suit you. If you are a tourist or visitor to Australia... please don't stay here. I would hate this to be the impression you got. My room looked straight into other apartments and the garbage truck woke me at 2am every morning. The exhaust in the bathroom never turned off, so although there was a giant bathtub no one in their right mind would try to relax in it with a noisy fan above. The rooms are "cleaned' each day but not really... they call it a "Partial Clean" which means they empty the bin and make the bed. That's it. The bed was made in the most unusual way. Instead of a doona cover they just put a plain doona between two shirts. Very uncomfortable when they slip in the night. I ended up pulling it all off and just having the doona. Internet wasn't too expensive. Around $25 a day with 100mb to download. Could be worse... could be better. Free WIFI is rare in Sydney. Would I stay there again? As someone who lived in Sydney for 12 years and was just visiting after moving OS it suited me well. I got a good deal so I might. However, I do love a good hotel... friendly staff... nice hotel rooms... fresh towels... so if you want more service or experience... head next door to the Marque.

Reviews.Title: “great location great apartment”
Reviews.Author: cazirola
Reviews.Content: We just wanted to be close to central so we could catch the train easily, but were pleasantly surprised to see we could just walk out the door to lots and lots of restaurants and the pub. The place was spotless and pleasantly decorated. The staff were courteous and helpful. We were fairly high up so had a GREAT view from both the bedroom balcony and the lounge room balcony. All appliances worked well. I don't understand the negative reviews - it was a lot better than the price or the advertising led us to believe. HOwever I do believe that some of the apartments are owner occupied. Some really strong domestic cooking smells were in the corridor, but did not enter the apartment.. For the price for the location and for Sydney it was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: breezey103
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Oaks Harmony and loved it. The property is in a fantastic location, right in the centre of Chinatown, only a short walk from central station. The front desk staff were lovely on arrival, giving us a brief run down on Sydney and where to go, what to do. We stayed on the 12th floor in a room looking towards George St. The room was spotless with everything we needed. I think all Oaks hotels are apartments, so we had a full kitchen, with a dishwasher and even a washer and dryer! It was fanatstic to be able to do a quick load of washing the night before we left as the worst thing after a holiday is all the washing! It was a great stay, and the staff were absolutely lovely. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Gayfitz
Reviews.Content: Was rather apprehensive at first as upon arrival hotel staff were speaking sternly to what were obviously recalcitrant guests who had been ordered to leave. However staff handled situation very professionally and most efficiently. We were very surprised to find our apartment was split level, a bedroom and bathroom on each level thus providing plenty of room for 4 people. Apartment took up full width of building thereby giving two different aspects from both sides of building. Apartment very quiet but it was lovely to hear the church bells ringing on Sunday morning. Appointments to kitchen and manchester provided were first class. As well, hotel is very conveniently located. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. We were only staying one night but a most suitable hotel for anyone having an extended stay. Definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: travel8or
Reviews.Content: I stay in Sydney regularly on business and have tried many apartments. This is definitely the worst of all the places I have stayed. The staff are extremely discourteous and unhelpful. The decor of the rooms is offensive and the outlook from most is into a carpark. Harsh fluorescent lighting recalls hospital nightmares. The air-conditioning is noisy and distracting. A lack of lifts means long waits in the lobby. The sound of garbage trucks in the lane behind the building wakes you everynight between midnight and 1am. My overall experience of this place was so bad I would think twice before even walking down the street it is in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: cavignan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Oaks for 7 nights in a 1-bedroom apartment, and got a good rate from the hotel. The best thing about this hotel is its location, its only 1 minute walk from Central Station or from the Central Station/George Street bus-stop. Going to anywhere was most convenient as all the buses will pass by the Central Station bus-stop. The hotel is also very near to Chinatown and very convenient for late dinners. The room is furnished in light colors, and it makes the room looks brighter and bigger. The bedroom, kitchen and toilet are clean. Kitchen was very convenient for eating breakfast, and sometimes for takeaway dinners. The living room was spacious and the dining area was not cramped. The bedroom and living room opens to a shared balcony, but as we were on the 10th floor, there was not much view except for street in front of the hotel. The air-conditioning/heating was very good too. Initially, we were cautious that the heating would not heat up the whole place properly, as the bedroom was a separate room. However, they heating is digitally controlled, and we can set it at a specific temperature, set the speed of the fan at Low/Medium/High and let it run continuously. The only problem was that after 2 days of continuous rain, the corner of the bedroom next to the balcony started leaking water in and the carpet at the corner started getting wet. The patch got bigger and we had to move our luggage away. But when the rain stopped, it stopped spreading but it took a while for the carpet to dry up. Overall, a great place to stay in Sydney due to the location, and pretty good condition of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A1 EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: LocationNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Most wonderful experience, that sums it for my family's 12 days' stay in Oaks Harmony. Having read some horrific experiences from trip advisor, we arrived at the service apartment with doubts in our minds. But, we must say it has turned into one of our most pleasant holiday stays. Some keys attributes about the service apartment. - location - only 1 minute walk to central station - food places in abundance, all within walking distance, if you are like me, I like chinese food, it is right at the doorstep of chinatown - within the shopping area, darling harbour etc - nice clean apartment - pleasant experience with reception staff - reasonably affordable within the city area Like I said, it was an A1 experience, so much so that we are going back to the same service apartment next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but rooms could have been cleaner”
Reviews.Author: gatorhon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Oaks Harmony for 8 nights while in Sydney over the Christmas/New Year's holiday. We loved the location near Central station and Darling Harbour. The close proximity to Paddy's Market was great too. We found a grocery store with great prices and a fabulous selection of Asian food. We did love the little kitchenette so we ate in for breakfast and cooked several dinners in as well. The rooms seemed to have a lot of dead bugs by the sliding glass door when we arrived and we never opened the door since the bugs and flys seemed so bad. It appeared that periodically they did clean the floors, but not often. We had no problems with them replenishing towels or other items. However, I learned the washing machine needed at least two packets of the detergent they give you to even think it got washed. The dishwasher didn't work and I didn't bother telling anyone. It just wasn't worth it and I was able to wash the dishes on my own and I figured they were probably cleaner anyway. My other major complaint was the neighbors across from us were very loud. I got the impression the people lived there. The door slammed at all hours of the day and night and shook every thing in our studio apartment. Minor items: the hot tub was not hot, at least not likein the USA and the bed was on wheels so every time you sat down or moved it rolled... I only wish the hotel was closer to Sydney Harbour, but overall the location was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traveloguy
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean room, spacious room although cheap furniture. If you want an apartment style room including laundry with a fab location, look no further than to stay here. My only complaint would be that the furniture is about as cheap as can be, although everything else makes up for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: pte-traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Oaks Harmony for the period from 11 Nov to 17 Nov and agree with the recent reviews that the service at the apartment was extremely bad. The service staff has a â€œcanâ€™t be botheredâ€� attitude and does not extend basic courtesy to its customers. We called the apartment a day before we arrived to request for an early check-in as our flight was expected to arrive at 6am in the morning and we have a three year old toddler with us. We were told that they could only accommodate an early check-in after 11am and request can only be made upon arrival. As our flight was delayed, we arrived at the hotel slightly before 11am but were informed that no rooms would be available until 2pm. When we arrived at the hotel again 5 minutes before 2pm, the person who served us earlier looked at us blankly, clearly forgetting our early request to check-in. She told us that she did not think any rooms were available yet and only locate an available room after we insisted. As our room was still not cleaned at 2pm in the following afternoon, we requested for fresh towels but were told that each towel will be charged at A$2. Although it was stated in their compendium that we could request for room service at specific time, it took two reminders over more than 2 hours before the apartment was cleaned. Basic necessities such as detergent, soap and shampoo were not replenished. We stayed three nights and returned two days later for another night stay. In the meantime, the service staff threw away the fax that we were expecting from our doctor. The best part was that she was not even apologetic, only commenting that they receive a lot rubbish fax all the time. On the last day of our stay, we requested for a late checkout and were told that they were fully booked and could only extend the checkout until 11am. When my husband asked whether we could checkout after 11am as our flight was in the late afternoon, the service staff suggested that we could do so by paying for another night stay, clearly forgetting that the apartments were supposed to be â€œfully bookedâ€�. When she realized that she had contradicted herself, she reluctantly said that we could stay until 12 pm instead. Although location of the hotel was convenient and the rooms are fairly clean, our experience was marred by the bad attitude and service of the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty lousy! Think twice before booking!”
Reviews.Author: miamoto
Reviews.Content: We ran into all sorts of problems with this hotel. After booking a two-night stay on wotif.com, we arrived to find no staff at the reception desk, just a security guard who was there to answer the phone and buzz people in and out of the carpark. Over the course of our stay there were multiple occassions where there was no hotel staff at the desk. We had to wait around for almost 40 minutes in the lobby for the hotel manager to return from her lunch break. When we did, she told us that the hotel was overbooked and that we should have been advised by phone that we were staying at a different Oaks hotel. Um, hello? We knew nothing of this? After we insisted that we weren't going to move to another hotel, she checked us in - but silently only checked us in for ONE night instead of the TWO we booked for (without even notifying us of that when she did!) - we only realised what she had done after looking at the booking receipt she had given us. When we queried this she said she wasn't sure we could stay the two nights because they were overbooked (no mention of this during check-in!) As for the room - the bed was small, and broken. One side sagged badly from broken slats and creaked from the slightest movement. The doona barely covered the bed - it must've been a single-sized doona on a double bed, because it definitely wasn't big enough! The toilet wasn't exactly clean. One of our towels had a big stain on it. There were dead moths in the wardrobe. The internal walls were very thin - we could hear everything happening in the corridors and other rooms, and woke multiple times during the night to the sound of the door across the hall slamming shut. Good things about it were the location, the pool and gym, and the laundry facilities - it was helpful to be able to throw our towels in the dryer, especially seeing that the hotel charged $2 for extra towels. Overall a pretty poor experience. We've stayed at the Oaks on Collins in Melbourne, which was nice, and had expected this to be the same. It definitely wasn't. We wont be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “service SUCKS”
Reviews.Author: happyeveryday
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this 2-bedroom apartment for a week and I was no happy about the services at all. Is it really 4-star hotel??? I strongly doubt it. First, the receptionists were not very helpful and they were not friendly at all. No SMILE when talking to you. It was like at the funeral or something. Second, I rented a car and I wanted to get a car space in the hotel. All they did was to charge me $20 a day. They did not tell me where to park nor where the entrance for parking was. When I asked them, they just gave me a look. Like I should have known the answers. I am just a visitor! Third, the A/C was not working at all. I called them the day I checked in and a few times during my stay and all they said were that they would fix it soon. Until the day I checked out, which was a week after, nothing had done. They did not even provide me a fan. Fourth, no sugar/coffee/tea was given after the second day. Fifth, they gave us dirty towels with brown stains! Sixth, they only made the beds in the master room. Seventh, the detergents were not replaced. and many more...... I mean, the apartment was very comfortable and it got almost everything you may need during your stay but I just don't think it was worth staying there for the services I got from them. Just my experience after all. Perhaps, it was all because of my race? I don't know....

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and comfortable apartments. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: LeonCapeTown
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in a one-bedroomed apartment during a trip to Sydney to attend a conference at the exhibition centre in Darling Harbour. The apartment was large, clean, modern and comfortable with all the necessary equipment (fully fitted kitchen, including dishwasher, and laundry/dryer with washing powder supplied). The bedroom was basic, but had a king-sized newish bed. Some of the apartments are owned by permanent residents, so it didn't feel like one was staying in a hotel. It is situated on the edge of Chinatown, so at times it felt like one was in Hong Kong rather than Sydney! There are plenty of restaurants in the area, as well as Paddy's Market. It is literally 3 minutes from the central station and George street, and 10 minutes walk from Darling Harbour. Internet access is available in the room for 55 cents a minute. There is a fair amount of ambient noise at night from people coming and going and the streets below. Ask for a quiet apartment. Also, the complex is NOT well sign-posted from the outside and can be difficult to find. Ask for a detailed map. All in all, generally good value - you get a discount for staying 7 days - and and very comfortable. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: expatbangkok
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean, big, new rooms with good quality washer and drier, everything worked. The previous tenant had nicked the adapter for the TV aerial but the handyman came in and replaced it within 30 minutes. We were given a late check out and reception organised an airport bus for us. Maids cleaned the rooms promptly, gym and pool were above average and there was a good cafe at the door. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We found cockroach in the room”
Reviews.Author: singal2007
Reviews.Content: I just came back after Easter Holiday, this was the 3rd time I'd been to Sydney, and this is the worst hotel I ever stay. I checked in 9pm at night, firstly, the light of the room didn't work, we went down to the reception and the security advised us there was no room service after 8pm; secondly, I requested a high floor quiet room, but they offered me a room in level 2, where my bed room was just next to the car park, the noise at 6am wake me up. We changed another room at level 6 next day, we requested King bed but it was the combine of 2 single beds. We found a hair inside the water pot. The drape was a single layer film only, we wake up very early every morning when the sun comes up. Though in the booking it stated room service was included, don't expect daily room service. They came to tidy up our bed only ONCE out of our 5 nights stay, which was after my husband's complaint. But they didn't sweep the floor. Don't stay the hotel during winter, because after we turn the air-con to warmer, there were cockroach came out under the sofa and kitchen, 1 of them died next to the microwave and nobody tidy it up. Only the location is good, but definitely I will not recommend this hotel nor stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: gazzzh
Reviews.Content: The apartments are in an excellent location in Sydney. A stones through from Central Station and a stroll to China Town and Darling Harbour. The 1 bedroom apartment that I booked was excellent as well. Clean, tidy and spacious and nicely decorated. Would recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: monkey123
Reviews.Content: I booked an excellent deal for a 1 bedroom apartment for 2 nights through the property's own Hot Deals section on their website. The property itself is located just off George Street near Central Station - my partner and I were able to walk there (5-10 minutes) with our bags after getting off the airport train. We arrived early in the morning after a long haul flight and, whilst the staff were not able to check us in straight away, they stored our bags and expedited the cleaning of the room so that we could check in 4 hours before the usual check-in time. We really appreciated this and it was indiciative of the helpful attitude that we found from all of the staff during our stay. Our room was well sized, with a separate bedroom, dining area, kitchenette/lounge and bathroom. In addition, the bathroom had a separate washing machine and dryer. The furnishing was all pretty modern, new and clean, if not of the highest quality (a certain Swedish furniture store spings to mind). The only issue we had with the room was that the bedroom backed out onto a service alleyway so, although it was on the 16th floor, you could hear garbage and delivery lorries during the night. We liked the place so much that we decided to stay there again on our return to Sydney. Despite the fact that not all days were available at the Hot Deals price on the company website, we spoke to the manager and she was able to secure us a unit at the same, low price. This second unit was also spacious and well furnished and, with its location further down the service alleyway, did not suffer from the noise problems of the first one that we tried. Overall - an excellent property.

HotelInfo.Name: Oaks Harmony
HotelInfo.Address: 107-121 Quay Street | Haymarket, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
